intro: Agrostemma fulgens, commonly known as the blazing crosswort, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its striking, bright yellow flowers with a distinctive cross-shaped pattern. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, featuring slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Agrostemma fulgens is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
